content: Created `outputs/references.bib` containing 14 curated seed BibTeX entries (textbooks, classic papers, and surveys/modern works) with consistent `keywords` tags for domain/subtopic/type and DOI/ISBN where applicable.

output.code:
from pathlib import Path
import json

target_path = Path('/mnt/data').joinpath('outputs/references.bib')
target_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)

chunks = []

chunks.append(r"""% Seed bibliography entries (10â€“20) spanning textbooks, classic papers, and modern surveys.
% Tagging convention (used in keywords): domain:<...>; subtopic:<...>; type:<textbook|classic|survey|modern>
@book{bishop2006prml,
  title = {Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning},
  author = {Bishop, Christopher M.},
  year = {2006},
  publisher = {Springer},
  address = {New York, NY},
  isbn = {978-0387310732},
  keywords = {domain:ml; subtopic:probabilistic-models; type:textbook}
}

@book{goodfellow2016deep,
  title = {Deep Learning},
  author = {Goodfellow, Ian and Bengio, Yoshua and Courville, Aaron},
  year = {2016},
  publisher = {MIT Press},
  address = {Cambridge, MA},
  isbn = {978-0262035613},
  url = {https://www.deeplearningbook.org/},
  keywords = {domain:ml; subtopic:deep-learning; type:textbook}
}

@book{murphy2012mlpp,
  title = {Machine Learning: A Probabilistic Perspective},
  author = {Murphy, Kevin P.},
  year = {2012},
  publisher = {MIT Press},
  address = {Cambridge, MA},
  isbn = {978-0262018029},
  keywords = {domain:ml; subtopic:probabilistic-models; type:textbook}
}

@book{hastie2009esl,
  title = {The Elements of Statistical Learning: Data Mining, Inference, and Prediction},
  author = {Hastie, Trevor and Tibshirani, Robert and Friedman, Jerome},
  year = {2009},
  edition = {2},
  publisher = {Springer},
  address = {New York, NY},
  isbn = {978-0387848570},
  doi = {10.1007/978-0-387-84858-7},
  keywords = {domain:stats; subtopic:statistical-learning; type:textbook}
}

@book{boyd2004convex,
  title = {Convex Optimization},
  author = {Boyd, Stephen and Vandenberghe, Lieven},
  year = {2004},
  publisher = {Cambridge University Press},
  address = {Cambridge, UK},
  isbn = {978-0521833783},
  keywords = {domain:optimization; subtopic:convex-optimization; type:textbook}
}

@book{pearl2009causality,
  title = {Causality: Models, Reasoning, and Inference},
  author = {Pearl, Judea},
  year = {2009},
  edition = {2},
  publisher = {Cambridge University Press},
  address = {Cambridge, UK},
  isbn = {978-0521895606},
  keywords = {domain:causality; subtopic:causal-inference; type:textbook}
}

@book{sutton2018rl,
  title = {Reinforcement Learning: An Introduction},
  author = {Sutton, Richard S. and Barto, Andrew G.},
  year = {2018},
  edition = {2},
  publisher = {MIT Press},
  address = {Cambridge, MA},
  isbn = {978-0262039246},
  url = {http://incompleteideas.net/book/the-book-2nd.html},
  keywords = {domain:rl; subtopic:foundations; type:textbook}
}

@inproceedings{vaswani2017attention,
  title = {Attention Is All You Need},
  author = {Vaswani, Ashish and Shazeer, Noam and Parmar, Niki and Uszkoreit, Jakob and Jones, Llion and Gomez, Aidan N. and Kaiser, {\L}ukasz and Polosukhin, Illia},
  booktitle = {Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems},
  year = {2017},
  pages = {5998--6008},
  url = {https://papers.nips.cc/paper/2017/hash/3f5ee243547dee91fbd053c1c4a845aa-Abstract.html},
  keywords = {domain:nlp; subtopic:transformers; type:classic}
}

@inproceedings{he2016resnet,
  title = {Deep Residual Learning for Image Recognition},
  author = {He, Kaiming and Zhang, Xiangyu and Ren, Shaoqing and Sun, Jian},
  booktitle = {2016 IEEE Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (CVPR)},
  year = {2016},
  pages = {770--778},
  publisher = {IEEE},
  doi = {10.1109/CVPR.2016.90},
  keywords = {domain:cv; subtopic:architectures; type:classic}
}

@article{kingma2015adam,
  title = {Adam: A Method for Stochastic Optimization},
  author = {Kingma, Diederik P. and Ba, Jimmy},
  journal = {International Conference on Learning Representations},
  year = {2015},
  url = {https://arxiv.org/abs/1412.6980},
  keywords = {domain:optimization; subtopic:stochastic-optimization; type:classic}
}

@article{pan2010transfer,
  title = {A Survey on Transfer Learning},
  author = {Pan, Sinno Jialin and Yang, Qiang},
  journal = {IEEE Transactions on Knowledge and Data Engineering},
  year = {2010},
  volume = {22},
  number = {10},
  pages = {1345--1359},
  doi = {10.1109/TKDE.2009.191},
  keywords = {domain:ml; subtopic:transfer-learning; type:survey}
}

@article{devlin2019bert,
  title = {BERT: Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding},
  author = {Devlin, Jacob and Chang, Ming-Wei and Lee, Kenton and Toutanova, Kristina},
  journal = {Proceedings of NAACL-HLT},
  year = {2019},
  pages = {4171--4186},
  doi = {10.18653/v1/N19-1423},
  keywords = {domain:nlp; subtopic:pretraining; type:modern}
}

@article{mnih2015dqn,
  title = {Human-level Control through Deep Reinforcement Learning},
  author = {Mnih, Volodymyr and Kavukcuoglu, Koray and Silver, David and Rusu, Andrei A. and Veness, Joel and Bellemare, Marc G. and Graves, Alex and Riedmiller, Martin and Fidjeland, Andreas K. and Ostrovski, Georg and Petersen, Stig and Beattie, Charles and Sadik, Amir and Antonoglou, Ioannis and King, Helen and Kumaran, Dharshan and Wierstra, Daan and Legg, Shane and Hassabis, Demis},
  journal = {Nature},
  year = {2015},
  volume = {518},
  number = {7540},
  pages = {529--533},
  doi = {10.1038/nature14236},
  keywords = {domain:rl; subtopic:deep-rl; type:classic}
}

@article{kipf2017gcn,
  title = {Semi-Supervised Classification with Graph Convolutional Networks},
  author = {Kipf, Thomas N. and Welling, Max},
  journal = {International Conference on Learning Representations},
  year = {2017},
  url = {https://arxiv.org/abs/1609.02907},
  keywords = {domain:ml; subtopic:graph-neural-networks; type:modern}
}""")

final_text = '\n'.join(block.strip('\n') for block in chunks).strip() + '\n'
target_path.write_text(final_text, encoding='utf-8')

print('FILE_WRITTEN:outputs/references.bib')
print('DIR_STATE:' + json.dumps(sorted(str(p.relative_to(Path("/mnt/data"))) for p in target_path.parent.glob('*') if p.is_file())))

content.text: Created `outputs/references.bib` containing 14 curated seed BibTeX entries (textbooks, classic papers, and surveys/modern works) with consistent `keywords` tags for domain/subtopic/type and DOI/ISBN where applicable.
